citation.article-title: Description of Persicirhabdus sediminis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ponti sp. nov., Roseibacillus persicicus sp. nov., Luteolibacter pohnpeiensis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Luteolibacter algae sp. nov., six marine members of the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia', and emended descriptions of the class Verrucomicrobiae, the order Verrucomicrobiales and the family Verrucomicrobiaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Roseibacillus (Ro.se.i.ba.cil′lus. L. adj. roseus rose-coloured, rosy; L. masc. n. bacillus a small staff or rod; N.L. masc. n. Roseibacillus a rose-coloured rod).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-negative and obligately aerobic.
Cells lack flagella and are non-motile.
The major respiratory menaquinone is MK-9.
The G+C contents of the genomic DNA of known strains are 57.3–61.4 mol%.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω9c and iso-C14 : 0.
The type species is Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis.
